metadata.description: Defensive reflex frameworks for rapid withdrawal, startle, and nocifensive reactions.
metadata.notes: Configured as qualitative maps ensuring no overlap with biomimetic defense routines.

withdrawal.stimulus: Sudden nociceptive input from skin or deeper tissues.
withdrawal.integration: Distributed interneuron networks orchestrating flexor synergy.
withdrawal.effector: Rapid retraction of the stimulated body part.

startle.stimulus: Abrupt acoustic, tactile, or visual threat cues.
startle.integration: Reticular startle circuit engaging cranial and spinal motor output.
startle.efferent: Facial, accessory, and spinal motor neurons.
startle.effector: Full-body co-contraction with eyelid blink and neck flexion.

blink.stimulus: Approaching object or sudden luminance change.
blink.afferent: Optic and trigeminal pathways to superior colliculus and brainstem.

flinch.effector: Brief muscle twitch repositioning the limb or shoulder.

pain_withdrawal.stimulus: Sustained nociceptive stimulus threatening tissue damage.
pain_withdrawal.afferent: C-fiber nociceptors ascending to spinal and supraspinal centers.
pain_withdrawal.integration: Spinal withdrawal pattern generator with descending modulation.
pain_withdrawal.efferent: Flexor and contralateral extensor motor pools.
pain_withdrawal.effector: Complex withdrawal with postural adjustment to avoid the source.
